channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-11920] Add CP hooks for ReplicationEndPoint
item.description:
If we want to create internal replication endpoints other than the one created thro configuration we may need new hooks. This is something like an internal scanner that we create during compaction so that the actual compaction scanner can be used as a delegator.
Enis Soztutar
If I can give a patch by tomorrow will it be possible to include in the RC?

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
We need change in ReplicationEndpoint for this?
CP hook around the creation of the ReplicationEndpoint using conf value would be sufficient?

HRS side
1. pre hook in RegionServerObserver -> This can return an Object of type ReplicationEndpoint. If not null just use that.
2. Create the ReplicationEndpoint impl object. The class name is specified in conf.
3. post hook in RegionServerObserver -> pass the object created #2. This can return an Object of type ReplicationEndpoint. If not null use that.

Using this way VC can impl the post hook and create a wrapper impl of ReplicationEndpoint delegating the calls to the actual impl object.

Will this work out Ram?
Removing from 0.98. Let's create an umbrella issue just for 0.98 for the work you are proposing Ram. We can later do what we did on HBASE-11546

>>We need change in ReplicationEndpoint for this?
What i meant was to make necessary changes (if any) in the replication interfaces like ReplicationSourcemanager to create hooks for Replication endpoints.
I updated the title to make it more clear and as suggested by Anoop.

This is the patch that would help in creating the new hooks. May be the change to Server from Stoppable is avoidable but passing Stoppable is more generic to retrive the CP host from it.
But one thing to note is that this change is not possible in 0.98 just because AccessController implements RegionServerObserver. So any new hooks added would affect BC.

I am not sure that I get the motive for this one. Do you want to change the RE for inter cluster replication? What about other REs?
Want to wrap the Inter cluster RE. The parent issue of this subtask speaks the motive/need

Enis Soztutar
Can we commit this to the branch-1 if you are fine with the patch after seeing the intention of doing it?

+  void postCreateReplicationEndPoint(ObserverContext<RegionServerCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx,

+      ReplicationEndpoint endpoint);

The hook should return ReplicationEndpoint . Then only u can wrap the incoming ReplicationEndpoint and make the wrapper to act as actual replicator at RS side.
Updated patch addressing comments.

Will it be better to use only the WalFilterchain. Currently we are not allowed to add our own filter to it. Anyway the above change will allow adding a new replication endpoint that tries to create a filter and add it to the filter chain I believe.
Just wanted to know which one will make it look better?
Updated patch with changes to the javadoc. BaseRegionServerObserver also returns null now.

+  @Override

+  public ReplicationEndpoint postCreateReplicationEndPoint(

+      ObserverContext<RegionServerCoprocessorEnvironment> ctx, ReplicationEndpoint endpoint) {

+    return null;

+  }

That is bit odd IMO Ram. Why can't it return the same endpoint coming in as param? This is the way other similar post hooks work (See postScannerOpen)

Actually if you see the javadoc for postScannerOpen 


  * @return an RegionScanner instance to use instead of the base scanner if

   * overriding default behavior, null otherwise

in preStoreScannerOpen


a KeyValueScanner instance to use or {@code null} to use the default implementation

So the caller is handling this, if not null then the returned value is used in the caller. So ideally we should return null in the base impl and ensure the caller is handling it.
Anyway then the older patch is fine then except for the java doc changes.

This javadoc is from preScannerOpen? Yes for the prexxx() hook if we don't want to have our own impl to be used, we can return null. On null the core will continue to instantiate its own impl. In postxxx it is passing the one it created and the hook can wrap it or even create a brand new instance also. (the former is mostly). If no change to the instance needed (but the CPwanted to do some other op on post hook) then just return whatever is coming in. That seems the right choice IMO.

That seems the right choice IMO.

+1, the post hook should return what was passed in if not making any changes. That's consistent with what we have done elsewhere.

updated patch. Now again reverts back to not returning null as in the previous patches. Updated the javadoc too. I am working on the parent JIRA also. So once this is committed will work on top of this.

nit :

{@code null}

if the default implementation is to
+ * be used.
Pls avoid saying "return null". Return the incoming instance itself is the best way. Just avoid that sentence.
